tool.name: Compute energy PWM
tool.help: The program calculates the dinucleotide position weight matrix associated to the deformation model provided in input, in a generalized JASPAR format. Each element (i,j) of the matrix gives the energy contribution of the i-th dinucleotide along the protein, when this nucleotide is the j-th out of the 16 possible dinucleotide sequences. The energy is in the arbitrary scale used by ThreaDNA. This matrix file can be handled by the PWM-subprogram of ThreaDNA for various operations: computation of energy profiles, combination with traditional mononucleotide PWM, transformation into probability PWM, etc.
